label: Sinai Arabic NF M 66, Undertext (Greek majuscule)

note: Only a few letters are visible. The parchment fragment is too small to reconstruct the number of columns and lines, but it is clear that the folio was made up from stitching together multiple pieces of parchment

note.value: Additional parts of this manuscript can be found in three further manuscripts: Leipzig, Univ. gr. 2 (22 folios) = Codex Tischendorf 2; St. Petersburg, RNB, gr. 26 (6 folios); Cambridge Add. 1879.5 (one small fragment). The characteristics of the layout and of the script suggest that this text originally belonged to an Old Testament manuscript (with additional parts in Leipzig, Cambridge, St. Petersburg) or to a grammatical text (with additional parts in Leipzig only)
Description of undertext by Giulia Rossetto
